altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Ephraim, Jacob. The second part of a Choral Service-book for the circle of the whole year. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 79 items.

msItem.title: The second part of a Choral Service-book for the circle of the whole year.
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܚ̇ܝ̣ܠܐ ܘܣܘܝ̇ܥܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܡ̇ܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟ̣ܬܘܒ ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܨܘܡܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ.

msItem.title: Order of the holy Fast of the Forty (Days), or Lent.
Order of Mār Ephraim, the Syrian Doctor, celebrated on Saturday in the first week of Lent; and commemoration of Mār Theodore the illustrious martyr.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܡ̇ܠܦܢܐ ܏ܣܘܪ. ܕܡ̇ܫܬ݁ܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܫܒܬܐ. ܕܫܒܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ ܕܨܘܡܐ. ܘܕܘܟܪܢܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܬܐܘܕܘܪܘܣ ܣܗܕܐ ܢܨ̇ܝܚܐ

msItem.title: Order of the second Sunday in Lent.
Of Monday in the second week of Lent.
Order of the third Sunday in Lent.
Order of the fourth Sunday in Lent.
Order of the fifth Sunday in Lent.
Order of the sixth Sunday in Lent.
Order of the forty holy Martyrs (of Sebaste).
Order of Lazarus of Bethany, celebrated on the Saturday before Palm-Sunday.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܠܥܙܪ ܕܡܢ ܒܝܬ ܥܢܝܐ ܕܡܫܬ݁ܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܫܒܬܐ ܕܩܕܡ ܐܘ̈ܫܥܢܐ

msItem.title: Order of the redeeming Passion of our Lord and our God and our Saviour Jesus Christ; with lessons from the Gospels (Peshitta version) interspersed.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܚ̣ܫܐ ܦܪܘܩܝܐ. ܕܡܪܢ ܘܐܠܗܢ ܘܦܪܘܩܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ

msItem.title: Order celebrated on the Thursday of the Mystery, after None.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܡ̇ܫܬ݁ܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܚܡܫܐ ܕܪܐܙܐ ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܬܫ̈ܥ ܫ̈ܥܝܢ

msItem.title: Order of the Friday of the Crucifixion (Good Friday).
Order of the Adoration of the Cross.
Order of the Saturday of Annunciation.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡܘ ܩ̈ܠܐ̣ ܘܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܚ̣ܫܐ. ܘܒܥ̈ܘܬܐ. ܘܡ܏ܕܪ̈. ܘܣܘ̈ܓܝܬܐ. ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫܒܬܐ ܕܚ̣ܫܐ ܦܪܘܩܝܐ. ܕܡܪܢ ܘܐܠܗܢ ܘܦܪܘܩܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ܀

msItem.title: Orders of the Resurrection.
msItem.note: They are eight in number, but the first, second, and sixth, are wanting.

msItem.title: Order of the Friday of the Confessors.
Order of the Ascension of our Lord to Heaven.
Order of the Feast of pentecost.
Order of S. Peter, the chief of the Apostles.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܦܛܪܘܣ ܪܝܫܐ ܕܫ̈ܠܝܚܐ ܕܗ̇ܘܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܗ ܒ܏ܟܚ ܒܚܙܝܪܢ
msItem.note: The subscription reads, "whose commemoration takes place on the 28th of Hăzīrān."

msItem.title: Order of S. Paul the Apostle, whose commemoration is on the 29th of Haziran.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܦܘܠܘܣ ܫܠܝܚܐ ܕܗ̇ܘܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܗ ܒ܏ܟܛ ܒܚܙܝܪܢ

msItem.title: Order of S. John the Evangelist.
Order of S. Thomas the Apostle.
Order of the Apostles in general (Common of the Apostles).
Order of Sergius and Bacchus, the illustrious martyrs.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܣܪܓܝܣ ܘܒܟܘܣ ܣܗ̈ܕܐ ܢܨ̇ܝ̣ܚ̈ܐ

msItem.title: Order of Mār George, the illustrious and famous martyr.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܓܐܘܪܓܝܣ ܣܗܕܐ ܢܨ̇ܝ̣ܚܐ ܘܛܒܝ̣ܒܐ

msItem.title: Order of Mār Quiricus, or Cyriacus, the martyr, and of his mother Julitta.
Order of the Maccabees, Shamūnī and her seven sons.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܡܩ̈ܒܝܐ ܫܡܘܢܝ ܘܫܒ̈ܥܐ ܒܢܝ̈ܗ̇

msItem.title: Order of the Martyrs in general (Common of the Martyrs).
Order of the Decease of Mary the Mother of God.
Order of the holy Festival of the Cross.

physDesc.p: Vellum, 16 5/8 in. by 12 5/8, consisting of 359 leaves, many of which are stained and torn. Originally the number of quires must have been about forty, fol. 346 being signed ܠܚ; but not a few are now defective, especially from fol. 299 onwards. In the earlier part of the volume there are lacunae after foll. 10, 27 and 296.

item.p: Vellum, 16 5/8 in. by 12 5/8, consisting of 359 leaves, many of which are stained and torn. Originally the number of quires must have been about forty, fol. 346 being signed ܠܚ; but not a few are now defective, especially from fol. 299 onwards. In the earlier part of the volume there are lacunae after foll. 10, 27 and 296.

handDesc.handNote: The hand is the same as that of Add. 12,146.

As in Add. 12,146, some of the madrashe are ascribed on the margins, by later hands, to Ephraim (e.g. foll. 170 a and 171 b) and Jacob (e.g. fol. 135 b), whilst the bā'ăvāthā are attributed in the text to either the one or the other, according to the metre.
Foll. 4, 5, 32, 33, 55, 56, 77, 78, 102, 103, 127 and 128, are supplementary paper leaves, inserted apparently during the xiiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.
N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: The manuscript has many rather rudely drawn ornaments; e.g. foll. 75 a, 97 a (two birds), 99 a (a tree and two birds), 108 b (a bird), 110 a (a bird), 113 b (a bird), 117 a, 167 a (a bird), 173 a (a fish), 174 a (a hand with a branch), 186 b (the same), 188 b, 196 a, 199 a, 217 a, 247 a (two feet), 252 a (a hand), 281 a, 285 a (two birds), 293 a, 321 a (a hand), and 329 b.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: On fol. 299 b there is the following note in heptasyllabic metre, mentioning the names of the scribe Yeshūa' and of Abū 'Alī Zakarīyā, at whose expense the manuscript was written.

p.quote: ܠܦܘܡܐ ܕܡ̇ܠ̣ܠ ܚܘܣܝܐ. ܘܠܐܝ̣ܕܐ ܕܟܬ݂ܒܬ݁ ܫܘܒܩܢܐ. ܠܐܡ̇ܘܪ̈ܐ ܘܠܫ̇ܡ̈ܘܥܐ. ܢܚ̣ܘܢ ܡܪܝܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ. ܡܪܝܐ ܝܫܘܥ ܕܒܩ̣ܛܠܟ. ܥܠܡܐ ܟܠܗ ܐܬܚ̇ܣ̣ܝ. ܚܲܣܐ ܚ̈ܛܗܐ ܒܛܝܒܘܬܟ. ܕܐܒܘܥܠܝ ܙܝܟܝܪܝ. ܘܡܐ ܕܟܣ̈ܝܬܐ ܡܬܓ̈ܠ̣ܝ̣ܢ. ܕܒܢ̈ܝ ܐܢܫܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ. ܒܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܝܟ ܚ̇ܦ̣ܐ ܣܢܝ̈ܬܗ܆ ܕܝܫܘܥ ܚܲܛܳܝܐ ܥܒ̣ܕܟ܀

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The scribe has also recorded his own name and that of his patron in several other places; e.g. foll. 75 a.

p.quote: ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚ̇ܣ̣ܐ ܠܐܒܘܥܠܝ ܙܟܪܝܐ̣ ܘܠܝܫܘܥ ܟܬܘܒܐ

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The scribe has also recorded his own name and that of his patron in several other places; e.g. foll. 99 a, 117 a, 166 b, 188 b, 250 b, 281 a, and 357 b

p.quote: ܒܨܠܝܒܟ ܡܪܢ. ܘܒܨܠܘܬܗ̇ ܕܡ݊ܪܝܡ. ܐܡܐ ܕܝܠ̣ܕܬܟ. ܨܠܝܒܟ ܢܗܐ ܓܫܪܐ. ܒܐܬܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܩܢ̣ܛܐ. ܠܝܫܘܥ ܚܲܛܝܐ. ܕܟܬ݂ܒ ܐܝܟ ܚ̇ܝ̣ܠܗ. ܐܡܝܢ܀

item.label: Colophon
item.p: To a marginal addition on fol. 68 b are appended the words: "written by Rabban Athanasius (or #Theōnas?), the disciple of our blessed Father; may the Lord grant him forgiveness."

p.quote: ܟܬ݂ܒ ܪܒܢ ܐܬܐܘܢܘܣ ܬܠܡܝܕܐ ܕܐܒܘܢ ܛ݁ܘܒܬܢܐ. ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܲܣܐ ܠܗ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script
